testimony: With Chairperson's permission I now call to the stand Mr Dhanpal Naidoo.

Thank you Chairperson.
	Mr Naidoo, are you also called Ricky?
You seek amnesty for the two events or incidents 17 and 18 in bundle 1, that is the attack on the Magistrate's Court, Chatsworth and the attack on Mr Rajbansi's house?
Were you part of the same unit as Mr Derek Naidoo?
You were not.  Did you belong to any unit?
Yes I was commander of a unit consisting of myself, Patrick Lerang who is now deceased and Phila Ndwandwe who subsequently was murdered by the Security Forces.
Yes.  And who was your commander?
That is Dr Ramlakan who applied for amnesty earlier today?
Do you associate yourself with the motives deposed to by Dr Ramlakan?
And you also subscribe to the reasons that he gave for the selection of the two targets?
With regard to Mr Rajbansi, did you have any personal grudge against him, did you bear him any ill will or spite?
What was your role in the Magistrate's Court incident?

My role in my unit and reporting to my commander Veejay Ramlakan was in the capacity of logistics and support.  I'd agreed to meet with them at a point in Chatsworth where I delivered a parcel to him which was comprising explosives.
So you provided the explosive device?
And what was your role in the matter relating to Mr Rajbansi's residence?
Similar to the Chatsworth Court experience, I'd met Veejay Ramlakan and delivered a similar parcel to him.
Did you derive any financial or material benefit from these two actions or two incidents?
You were not convicted of these offences?

Yes.  That is the evidence, Chairperson.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MOERANE

Thank you Chairperson.
	You too, did you have any contact with the applicant Raymond Lalla in relation to these events for which you apply?

Thank you Chairperson.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MS CAMBANIS

I have no questions.
NO QUESTIONS BY MS MOHAMED
What was your involvement, if any, in the bombing of the Chatsworth Magistrate's Court?
I delivered a parcel to Veejay Ramlakan as I indicated earlier, that was as far as I was aware of the bomb.
Were you aware that it was going to be used in that operation?
Not at that point in time, no.
Did you later learn then that it was in fact used in that operation?

It was much later after the processes of  Veejay
Ramlakan's trial.

Thank you Chairperson, no further questions.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MAPOMA
At the time you handed him both these two parcels, were you aware that he was going to use them or other cadres might use them to cause some explosion or other?
As Veejay Ramlakan indicated earlier to the Commission, it was simply an instruction to bring the parcel to him.  I didn't question my orders.

Yes, I'm not asking whether you questioned your orders, but if you're an average human being of average intelligence and someone says to you bring me a limpet mine, to me it would seem pretty obvious that that limpet mine would then be used somewhere?
And you must have foreseen that?
It would have been in the nature of our operations.
Were these limpet mines that you delivered?
Were they limpet mines that you delivered?
Sorry, just one other thing.  Where did you get them from?
It was from the place that where I resided.
So you were in charge of ordinance?
Well where did they come from?
From Veejay Ramlakan.  We shared the residence together.
Did he provide the limpet mines and you stored them?
So it would appear you acted like you were a courier?
Did you have any dealings with Mr Raymond Metheraj?
Not directly, I see.  I have no further questions.

Mr Raymond Metheraj Saclou.
	Thank you, may the witness be excused?  Thank you.
NO FURTHER QUESTIONS BY MR MOERANE
WITNESS EXCUSED
